snippet: A journey through the borderlands found that the slow-boiling resentment over the troubles wrought by Syria’s war may be a mere prologue to the danger that lies ahead.
abstract: Journey through borderlands of Turkey and Syria reveals region increasingly on edge; as Turkey’s leaders show less willingness to play only a behind-the-scenes role in aiding Syria’s rebels, people here are feeling  slow-boiling resentment over tens of thousands of refugees, economic hardships and ethnic tensions wrought by  Syrian conflict.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: A journey through the borderlands found that the slow-boiling resentment over the troubles wrought by Syria’s war may be a mere prologue to the danger that lies ahead.
